title: Casualty review with spoilers: Rash throws a punch at Ethan
text:
Not making mistakes (Picture: BBC)

This episode of Casualty started off with Rash (Neet Mohan) in a sunny mood, riding his bike to work with a happy smile on his face. A terrible collision with a tractor seemed inevitable, but instead what (or who) he collided with was Ethan (George Rainsford). This turned out to have consequences that were almost as bad as colliding with a tractor.

Having his coffee spilled by a happy junior doctor on a bike was not an ideal start to Ethan’s shift. He was preoccupied with trying to ignore Effie’s calls and having the guilt of lying to Theo hanging over him, but it was Rash who was really getting on his nerves.

This was entirely unfounded, as Rash and his sidekick Mason (Victor Oshin) dealt beautifully with a man who suddenly started coughing up blood. Mason discovered that the man had had a gastric band operation and then gone on a long-haul flight soon afterwards, and they swiftly dealt with the ensuing pulmonary embolism. But they got no thanks from Ethan, who was just annoyed that the PE had been missed in the first place. He wasn’t interested in their explanation that they had no reason to suspect anything more sinister than asthma. Ethan tutted and mentioned all the mistakes Rash has been making recently (almost all of which were Mason’s fault) and told him there was no way he could support him for the CT1 position.

Then Ethan complained that Rash had spent most of the day on the phone to his father and told him, ‘You have to find a way to move on from your grief.’ And Rash decked him with a total slugger of a punch that was completely unexpected. Mason witnessed all of this and followed Rash outside to put a comforting hand on his shoulder – but will he back Rash up after failing to speak up for him earlier?

Meanwhile, David (Jason Durr) was surprised to spot his own name – along with love hearts – in correspondence between Rosa (Jacey Salles) and her mum. It turned out that Rosa had told her fussy mum that she had a boyfriend and David was the first name that came to mind. ‘You’re not David!’ she told David. ‘Not the David!’ No wonder David looked confused. Eventually she told him she’d once been married and had a son, who’d died when he was eight years old. In her grief she’d taken to her bed for three years, during which time her marriage ended. Her mother supported her through all of this and that’s why she’s so protective of Rosa now.

Rosa and Ollie bond (Picture: BBC)

Rosa and Ollie (Harry Collett) have developed a lovely bond and he talks to her about things he finds uncomfortable talking to David about – like his constant worry that he may be bipolar like his dad. David realised this, and when Rosa said she was leaving he asked her to stay. ‘You are a brilliant fake mum,’ he told her. Ollie is moving in with David permanently, and David has promised Rosa that he’ll pose as her boyfriend whenever her mother visits, which should be excellent fun.

Robyn makes a kind offer (Picture: BBC)

Duffy (Cathy Shipton)’s first day as a volunteer in the ED didn’t go well. She was helpful and lovely as always, but it exhausted her so much she had to go home at lunch time. In a heartbreaking scene Charlie (Derek Thompson) told Robyn (Amanda Henderson) that Duffy has given so much to the NHS, but now she needs help herself she keeps being put on waiting lists. Lovely Robyn offered to give him some money so he could take Duffy to a private clinic. He said no, but was really moved by her kindness.

Sue Haasler is the author of five novels and the official BBC Holby City book, which you can read about here.
